entry.title: Move to sync files on Linux Vulkan
entry.content:
OzoneImageBacking on Linux expects GpuFence to be sync files (e.g. for

GL/Vulkan interop). Switch all Linux Vulkan platform implementations to

use sync files as the primary external semaphore handle type to ensure

compatibility with GpuFence.



This also deletes VulkanImplementation::GetExternalImageHandleType as

it's completely unused.



Bug: 1411745

Change-Id: I25f56a2ccf119cbbc9f6d910880cb8853c2add4e

entry.title: WebNN: Support WebNN Constant operand in mojo.
entry.content:
There is a `BigBuffer` in mojo for each constant weight data, all

array buffers will be uploaded into one D3D 12 resource for DirectML

backend, the constant data is specified with

DML_TENSOR_FLAG_OWNED_BY_DML flag when creating the tensor desc.



The number of input buffer binding for graph initialization must

exactly match the number of inputs sub constants, and the order of the

DML_BUFFER_BINDING array is inputs, and then constants.



Bug: 1273291

entry.title: Implement Cache rule for the main resource load.
entry.content:
This makes the cache storage API accessible from the

ServiceWorkerMainResourceLoader upon the static routing API rule

(https://github.com/WICG/service-worker-static-routing-api).



If the cache source is specified, the browser process directly

communicate with the cache storage API to have a fetch API response

that matches the given request.

entry.title: [Files app] Ducks: add addAction method to Slice
entry.content:
The addAction method allow actions to be created in

a way that lets multiple reducer across different slices

handle the same action type.



As a demonstration of this new method, the reducer function

`updateDeviceConnectionStateReducer` has been split into

2 slices: volumes and device.



Notice that, as expected, call sites remain unchanged as a

result of this CL.



Bug: b:295777015

Test: browser_tests FileManagerJsTest.ReducerDevice

entry.title: [protoc_wrapper] Do not add --import-dir if it doesn't exist
entry.content:
The original issue was `warning: directory does not exist` output in remote proto wrapper command.

https://crrev.com/c/4812586 suppressed it by including --import-dir to remote inputs. But it turned out that it sometimes crushes Reproxy.



This CL instead fixes `protoc_wrapper.py` to check the presence of `--import-dir`.



Fixed: b/297428306, b/298129445

entry.title: Fix DataPipeDrainer usage in ExtensionLocalizationURLLoader
entry.content:
There is a bug that when ExtensionLocalizationURLLoader is destructed

by canceling the CSS requests from extensions, DataPipeProducer may

cause UAF.

This is because DataPipeProducer is not correctly used in

ExtensionLocalizationURLLoader. DataPipeProducer and the data must be

kept alive until notified of completion.



This CL fix this by changing ExtensionLocalizationURLLoader to keep

DataPipeProducer and the data even if ExtensionLocalizationURLLoader

itself is destructed.



Bug: 1475798

Change-Id: I013396f2c49f4712914b917c3330b99a1be791b8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4821086

Reviewed-by: Takashi Toyoshima

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Commit-Queue: Tsuyoshi Horo

entry.title: Fix initial glanceables calendar scroll to today
entry.content:
Avoid laying out glabceables container, and setting calendar view bounds

until the glanceables container has been set up. CalendarView has logic

to scroll the current date to be visible when its bounds are set - in

the glanceables bubble, the calnedar view bounds were getting set before

the calendar view content bounds were fully configured. The calendar's

scroll view view port was including the whole scroll view contents, so

scrolling to a position that included the current date view was no-op

(because the scroll view thought the view was not really scrollable).

This bypasses bubble updates due to glanceables bubble view preferred

size changes until the glanceables content has been initialized (and the

calendar view height was set to the desired value).



BUG=b:298322825



Change-Id: I201339fbea81abe0145c7dfe57246cd3a375836d

entry.title: Speculative fix for crash with incognito alert dialog - round 2
entry.content:
When the incognito dialog was migrated to the modal dialog manager the

protections around multiple dialog results was removed (was originally

added in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4220037)



I'm not sure if this is the source of the crash this time (is the modal

dialog manager broken in the same way the old alert dialog was?), but I

can't reproduce the issue so this speculative fix is the best way

forward.

entry.title: Multiplanar: Add WritePixelYUV support in VideoFrameYUVMailboxHolder
entry.content:
This change adds UseWritePixelsYUV media switch that is enabled by

default except on Windows that needs some support in Angle. It adds

multiplanar shared image support for software pixel upload path where

the video frame does not have textures and the pixels are uploaded

directly through WritePixels. It uses the new WritePixelsYUV path

for multiplanar shared images where pixels for all planes are done in

one raster interface call. Here, we also gate the switch on

UseMultiPlaneFormatForHardwareVideo which is the hardware decode path

that is enabled by default on Android and finching on mac/windows.



Bug: 1465939

entry.title: snap-group: Same app cycle
entry.content:
This cl implements the cyling within the same app, this feature

is currently behind the flag `SameAppWindowCycle`.



Special considerations for this use case:

1. We will create container view for snap group only when the two

windows both belong to the app;

2. With the cycling step doubled in b/293367123, we need to adjust

the logic so that it will only double for group item.

3. With windows been re-ordered in the cycle list, the front window

will not guaranteed to be the mru window. In the case of a snap

group at beginning, we need to get the mru window between the two

windows in a snap group;

4. On window destruction while cycling, we need to reset the preset

corner radius window cycle item view.



Fixed: b/293366576

Demo: http://b/293366576#comment2, http://b/293366576#comment3,

http: //b/293366576#comment4

Test: Added unit tests + manual

Change-Id: If607af9533907b3177c8149a63043d7161e006b2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4823771

Reviewed-by: Sammie Quon

kEnableVariableRefreshRate enabled, BackToBackBeginFrameSource can

get stuck waiting for a compositor frame ACK that never arrives,

because OnBeginFrame is never sent from viz.

in TabPersistentStore (with the exception of TabLoader). The

entry.title: [APS] Trigger zero-prefix dropdown on tapping the omnibox after it is
entry.content:
auto-focused



Opening the NTP automatically focuses on the omnibox with a blinking

cursor and without triggering the zero-prefix dropdown when a physical

keyboard is connected to a tablet device.



This CL adds support to show the zero-prefix dropdown when the omnibox

is tapped at this point.



This CL also renames/repurposes AutocompleteMediator#onUrlFocusChange() to report metrics and activate/deactivate the autocomplete session as follows:

1. The autocomplete session will not be activated when the omnibox is initially focused. This will be done only if the user taps on / types into the omnibox after such focus.

2. If the user chooses not to interact with the omnibox after such focus, the autocomplete session deactivation logic in this method will not be executed.



Bug: 1445822

entry.title: Remove SK_USE_LEGACY_BLUR_IMAGEFILTER staging flag
entry.content:
With the removal of this flag, CPU-based blurs will now respect the

SkTileMode passed to the blur image filter. Both GPU and CPU blurs

will tend to have more optimal image sizes (smaller) when using

kDecal. kDecal should also use fewer renderpasses. There is a

temporary regression in image size and renderpasses for other tile

modes but this is a required step in the overall blur refactoring.



It also fixes a bug where decal would be applied to the intersection

of both the filter region and primitive subregion when performing

blurs in SVGs. This is why there are larger changes to the

`effect-reference-subregion`: the blur is able to read the hidden color cells of the input image, some of which are red so the overall blur color shifts from green to brownish.



Most viz pixel tests have benign updates. However, the blur_filter_with_clip test is meant to have clamped content. The SW

expected image had baked in the previous limitation of decal-only

blurs which is no longer the case. However, the software_renderer

compositor seems to be sizing images a little off so the clamp is only

applying to the top and left edges. Now the new expected image is

just half wrong :)



Chromium is still relying on deprecated behavior for clamped blurs

where it doesn't specify the clamping geometry with the image filter.

This will require more changes but would likely get around the issue

with how the software_renderer prepares the images to be blurred.



Numerous ash pixel tests had to be updated, but I couldn't spot any

meaningful differences in their content. My guess is that the widgets

and windows all had some amount of blur use, so this change touched

everywhere.

entry.title: shortcuts: Open the shortcuts app with right shortcuts selected
entry.content:
The shortcuts app already has the capacity to navigate to the selected

shortcuts in the search result. The mechanism is to append the action

and category of a shortcut to the app URL by the search and then the app

will retrieve those info and the page will scroll to the right position.



Example URL: chrome://shortcut-customization/?action=7&category=2.



In the launcher, we save the action and category info for each shortcuts

and pass them via query string in the same format as mentioned above to

the shortcuts app.



Since the shortcuts app will fetch all accelerators async, we need

to wait for the operation completed before trying to navigate to the

selected shortcuts. OnLayoutInfosFetched is a good place to initialize

the navigation.



Screenshots:

- Launcher Search: http://screen/6oAZsAE4cFhbEvp.png.

- Shortcuts app: http://screen/6nYscCkuXqQ3imw.png.



Bug: b/216049298

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=KeyboardShortcutResultTest.* and manually test on VM.

entry.title: Introduce kReadWriteExisting mode for FileMetricsProvider.
entry.content:
This adds a new kReadWriteExisting enum value for use in

FileMetricsProvider. In this mode, the file will be opened

as read-write, but if the file header is not initialized, it

will be treated as corrupt.



This aims to prevent the ~80% of crashes of crbug.com/1381122

where FileMetricsProvider is trying to initialize the header

of a memory-mapped file, while its job is actually just to

read data produced externally.

entry.title: Prefetch: Avoid overwriting failure reason when already set
entry.content:
When we evict a prefetch that failed (this happens when the speculation

candidate for the prefetch is removed), we try to overwrite the

pre-existing failure reason for the corresponding PreloadingAttempt.

This triggers a CHECK here [1]. This CL adds logic that prevents the

PreloadingAttempt failure from being overwritten in such a scenario.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/preloading/preloading_attempt_impl.cc;l=161;drc=38e0c404cb76aa7446df2cba4a8fae88b6b1e2a3

entry.title: Reland "[Mac] Implement App Nap behaviour for background renderers"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit ac1cbbbeec1da8eedb29f7adaa1352665c73073a



Original change's description:

> [Mac] Implement App Nap behaviour for background renderers

>

> With App Nap, sleeping processes are blocked from using too much of

> the system's resources. Under the hood, this is achieved by applying

> a suppression policy to the processes.

>

> With this change, background renderers will have that same suppression

> policy applied to them, which should have a significant effect on the

> performance of other processes.

>

> Another consequence of App Nap is that the OS gives that process a

> default task role of TASK_FOREGROUND_APPLICATION, and its QoS

> settings are set to tier 0.

>

> Thus this CL also updates the `SetCurrentTaskDefaultRole` function to

> apply the same default values to each child process. (The browser

> process already has those settings applied by the OS).

>

> This change only affect MacOS.

>

> Bug: 1466479

> Change-Id: I156606714f586774ec1a9615358a2627c87f6763

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4788107

> Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

> Commit-Queue: Patrick Monette

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1185246}



Bug: 1466479

Change-Id: I7bde2967893c6a8ca05ce95ba73b28d4a9911089

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4800176

Reviewed-by: Francois Pierre Doray

Commit-Queue: Patrick Monette

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190984}

entry.title: Quantify and log the amount of flickering between partial recognition results
entry.content:
Flickering due to unstable partial recognition results/translations has

been the top complaint from users dogfooding Live Translate. The first

step in making improvements in this area is to define a metric to

quantify the amount of flickering. This CL logs a metric defined in [1]

that will be used to evaluate future improvements.



[1] https://g3doc.corp.google.com/speech/service/s3/services/translate/g3doc/evaluation/metrics.md?cl=head#erasure

entry.title: Copy to WebGPU swap texture before taking snapshot
entry.content:
With WebGPU canvas contexts if an unsupported format for the platform

is being used then the texture needs to be copied to the swap texture

with the preferred format prior to a snapshot being taken (for drawing

to a 2D canvas, for example.) This ensures that the format aligns

entry.title: Android: Comprehensive errors for wrong bitness
entry.content:
Previously the custom exception message only showed up when the browser

started through ChromeBrowserInitializer or AsyncInitializationActivity

but not if it's done through LibraryLoader earlier in startup.



To prevent other uses from slipping through without the improved

exception message, a new callback was added for UnsatisfiedLinkErrors

caught in LibraryLoader. This callback is set in

SplitCompatApplication#attachBaseContext as early as is reasonable

(after ContextUtils.initApplicationContext) and can be set by other

embedders if they choose.



Use build flags to determine whether we are in the failing configuration

(Running the browser in 64-bit mode but native library is 32-bit or vice

versa).



Rewrite LaunchFailedActivityTest to check for the intent being sent

since LaunchFailedActivity has been moved to a separate process

(otherwise its dialog will disappear when the RuntimeException is raised

early during browser process startup).



Tests have been added for ProcessInitException and RuntimeException

being raised when unable to load the native library due to bitness

mismatch.



These two mechanism ensure end-users are notified to update by the

dialog and devs are notified by the RuntimeException with a detailed

message in logcat.



LaunchFailedActivity is started in a separate process which is not

instrumented in tests, so it cannot be covered by our existing

instrumentation tests. Prior to being moved in this CL it had good

coverage so it should work just the same, it is also a very low churn

file.



Low-Coverage-Reason: See above.

entry.title: Mac: don't check that window size == screen size in fullscreen tests
entry.content:
This doesn't necessarily hold in immersive fullscreen, since the OS

manages a separate window to handle the menu bar and topchrome reveal.

Additionally, fullscreen is a specific mode on macOS, rather than

just a screen-sized window, so a heuristic is not necessary in the

presence of firmer signals.



Testing reveals that FullscreenNotificationObserver is sufficient to

ensure that the fullscreen transition is finished on Mac, so skip this

check.
